review: Having a remote is nice, but the buttons are a little too sensitive. Quality and performance is great and all the major media apps seem to be there. Ples, Hulu, Netflix, prime video all work great. Amazon content is front and center which is a pro and a con. As a Prime member it's way easier to get to Prime video than on my blu-ray player. But it's also got all the other Amazon content front and center, and I am not into that ecosystem outside of Prime. I have not tried any non media related apps.
author: Ron Diaz

author: JAC

review: I've used a Roku products most of my streaming life and I'm more than a little used to that interface. With that said I decided to try the Fire Stick and while I wasn't disappointed in the hardware or performance I am not a fan of Amazon's interface (also not a fan of Kindle Fire interface). That's a personal preference though, there's not necessarily anything wrong with the interface, it's just overly busy for my taste. Everything seems perform snappy after the initial setup which was quite laggy for several minute or more while apps and preferences were synced and downloaded. I would probably buy again if the price was right but would most likely return to Roku if similar specs were available there.
author: Austin Haynes "Sinitron"
